result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryant J. Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying a Concealed Knife [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.231.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any sentence currently serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryant J. Beck

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 10:40 am.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears from MCJ, and with Attorney Paige Metzman. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

PLEA to Ct.1(Carrying a Concealed Knife/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 9 months MCJ, to run concurrent to any sentence currently serving.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge (60 days to pay) and provide sample. 

COURT grants 92 days credit. 
Adj: 10:45 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:00 am 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Paige Metzman. 
Discovery is out. Parties are continuing to discuss case. 
COURT leaves date on the calendar as set. 
Adj: 10:01 am
Re: Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum

Defendant house in Taylor County Jail

Final pre-trial on July 28, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Jury status hearing on August 30, 2022 at 02:05 pm.
Jury Trial on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): M.G. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:21 pm 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Peter Vu (Special Appearance). 
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

Argument re: bond. 
COURT ORDERS: $250 cash bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): MG. 
- No possession of dangerous weapons.
